parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the group radio callsign, how it will be displayed in radio chat. Two groups on the same side '''cannot''' have the same callsign (different side is possible). When trying to apply the same callsign to two groups of the same side, the callsigns will simply be swapped, e.g:
<code>group1 [[setGroupId]] ["Active Group"];
group2 [[setGroupId]] ["Inactive Group"];

group2 [[setGroupId]] ["Active Group"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>group1 is "Inactive Group" now</value></part></template></code>

The identity setup can also consist of format keywords (marked with %) and param keywords taken from '''CfgWorlds''' config.
Basically it is like [[format]] command but with some special group keywords (See Example 2).

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Possible <template><title>arma3</title></template> values: <ext><name>spoiler</name><attr/><inner>
'''%GroupSquad''':
* "Squad1" → 1
* "Squad2" → 2
* "Squad3" → 3
* "Squad4" → 4

'''%GroupPlatoon''':
* "Platoon1" → 1
* "Platoon2" → 2
* "Platoon3" → 3
* "Platoon4" → 4

'''%GroupCompany''':
* "CompanyAlpha" → Alpha
* "CompanyBravo" → Bravo
* "CompanyCharlie" → Charlie
* "CompanyDelta" → Delta
* "CompanyEcho" → Echo
* "CompanyFoxtrot" → Foxtrot
* "CompanyGolf" → Golf
* "CompanyHotel" → Hotel
* "CompanyIndia" → India
* "CompanyKilo" → Kilo
* "CompanyLima" → Lima
* "CompanyMike" → Mike
* "CompanyNovember" → November
* "CompanyOscar" → Oscar
* "CompanyPapa" → Papa
* "CompanyQuebec" → Quebec
* "CompanyRomeo" → Romeo
* "CompanySierra" → Sierra
* "CompanyTango" → Tango
* "CompanyUniform" → Uniform
* "CompanyVictor" → Victor
* "CompanyWhiskey" → Whiskey
* "CompanyXray" → X-Ray
* "CompanyYankee" → Yankee
* "CompanyZulu" → Zulu

'''%GroupNames''':
* "Alpha" → Alpha
* "Bravo" → Bravo
* "Charlie" → Charlie
* "Delta" → Delta
* "Echo" → Echo
* "Foxtrot" → Foxtrot
* "Golf" → Golf
* "Hotel" → Hotel
* "November" → November
* "Kilo" → Kilo
* "Yankee" → Yankee
* "Zulu" → Zulu
* "Two" → Two
* "Three" → Three
* "Buffalo" → Buffalo
* "Guardian" → Guardian
* "Convoy" → Convoy
* "Fox" → Fox

'''%GroupColors''':
* "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
* "GroupColor1" → Black
* "GroupColor2" → Red
* "GroupColor3" → Green
* "GroupColor4" → Blue
* "GroupColor5" → Yellow
* "GroupColor6" → Orange
* "GroupColor7" → Pink
* "Six" → Six
</inner><close></spoiler></close></ext></value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> From '''<template><title>arma</title></template>''', you can freely decide the callsign, e.g <template><title>Inline code </title><part><name index="1"/><value> [[group]] [[player]] [[setGroupId]] ["First Assault Recon Team"];</value></part></template>.</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> In '''<template><title>ofp</title></template>''', group ID cannot be freely decided and format must be of [letter, colour, picture] or [letter, colour]. Possible values: <ext><name>spoiler</name><attr/><inner>
'''Letter:'''
* "Alpha"
* "Bravo"
* "Charlie"
* "Delta"
* "Echo"
* "Foxtrot"
* "Golf"
* "Hotel"
* "Kilo"
* "Yankee"
* "Zulu"
* "Buffalo"
* "Convoy"
* "Guardian"
* "November"
* "Two"
* "Three"
* "Fox"

'''Colour:'''
* "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
* "GroupColor1" → Black
* "GroupColor2" → Red
* "GroupColor3" → Green
* "GroupColor4" → Blue
* "GroupColor5" → Yellow
* "GroupColor6" → Orange
* "GroupColor7" → Pink
* "Six" → Six
</inner><close></spoiler></close></ext>
The radio callsign strings can be overwritten in a mission by writing [[Stringtable.csv|Stringtable]] entries of the same name. Some entry names: <ext><name>spoiler</name><attr/><inner>
* STR_CFG_''GRPNAMES''_'''ALPHA'''
* STR_CFG_''GRPNAMES''_'''FOX'''
* STR_CFG_''GRPCOL''_'''BLACK'''
* STR_CFG_''GRPNAMES''_'''SIX''' (unlike its name suggests, this is a "group colour")
* STR_CFG_FIREFLYBASE
* STR_CFG_PAPABEAR
* STR_CFG_HQ_BASE</inner><close></spoiler></close></ext></value></part></template>

For the global variant of this command see [[setGroupIdGlobal]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> group [[setGroupId]] [nameFormat, nameParam1, ..., nameParamN] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> group: [[Object]] or [[Group]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [nameFormat, nameParam1, ..., nameParamN]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> nameFormat: [[String]] - format template (%keyword1 - %keyword2...etc) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> nameParam1: [[String]] - param keyword </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> '''<template><title>arma3</title></template>''':<code>[[group]] [[player]] [[setGroupId]] ["Some name for the group"];
[[hint]] [[groupId]] [[group]] [[player]];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>"Some name for the group"</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[sideChat]] "lalala";	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Some name for the group (KK): "lalala"</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> '''<template><title>arma3</title></template>''':<code>[[group]] [[player]] [[setGroupId]] ["%GroupNames :<template><title>=</title></template>: %GroupColors", "Alpha", "GroupColor2"];
[[hint]] [[groupId]] [[group]] [[player]];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>"Alpha :<template><title>=</title></template>: Red"</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[sideChat]] "lalala";	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Alpha :<template><title>=</title></template>: Red (KK): "lalala"</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> '''ArmA / <template><title>arma2</title></template> / <template><title>arma3</title></template>''': <code>_group1 [[setGroupId]] ["Assault Squad"];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> '''OFP''': <code>_group1 [[setGroupId]] ["Delta", "GroupColor4"]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setGroupIdGlobal]], [[groupId]], [[group]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 21, 2015 - 23:21 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
List of available keywords from config: <code>"[[if]] (([[configName]] _x) select [0, 5] == 'group') [[then]] {
	[[diag_log]] ('%' + [[configName]] _x);
	[[for]] '_i' [[from]] 0 [[to]] [[count]] [[_x]] - 1 [[do]] {
		[[diag_log]] ('* ""' + [[configName]] (_x [[select]] _i) + '"" → ' + [[getText]] (([[_x]] [[select]] _i) >> 'name'));
	};
}; [[false]]" [[configClasses]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgWorlds");</code>
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
